title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
description: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: 24 years on, why ex-MLA family’s massacre has returned to haunt Haryana amid fresh row
Watch: Congress leader and former Union Minister Shivraj Patil passes away
description: Senior Congress leader and former Union Home Minister Shivraj Patil passed away at 90 in his hometown Latur on December 12 after a brief illness. A seven-term MP and former Lok Sabha Speaker, Patil held key portfolios including Home, Defence, and Commerce, and later served as Governor of Punjab. Known for his dignity, scholarship, and deep grasp of constitutional matters, he remained a respected figure across parties. Tributes poured in from national leaders.

'DKS will be CM ...': Cong MLA reignites rumours; confirms dy CM hosted dinner
description: Karnataka Congress MLA Iqbal Hussain claimed Deputy Chief Minister D K Shivakumar will become chief minister after the ongoing winter session, fueling speculation of a leadership change. Hussain, who attended a dinner with legislators, stated Shivakumar's elevation is due to his efforts and party contributions, with the high command to make the final decision.

title: From ages 8 to 18: How an all-girl team is taking free chess to rural India
description: A program called Checkmate Betul is bringing chess to girls in rural India. Initiated by Avika Shukla, the program teaches valuable skills like critical thinking and decision-making. The initiative has expanded to Uttar Pradesh and aims to reach more girls. It provides online lessons and physical boards, fostering confidence and new opportunities for young learners.

title: Chaos, confusion and cancellations

'Cricketers indulge in vices during overseas tours': Ravindra Jadeja's wife claims
description: Ravindra Jadeja's wife, Rivaba, has sparked discussion by alleging that some Indian cricketers engage in vices during overseas tours, while asserting her husband remains untouched by such activities. She highlighted that players often act freely away from public scrutiny, but Jadeja, understanding his responsibilities, avoids these temptations. Her remarks have gained traction online.

title: 'Something wrong in HC': SC scraps plea on Karur stampede probe; warns TN govt
description: The Supreme Court rejected Tamil Nadu's plea to modify its order suspending the state's inquiry commission and SIT probe into the Karur stampede. Emphasizing fairness, the bench also criticized a Madras High Court report on a writ petition's registration. The court previously ordered a CBI investigation and a supervisory committee.

title: India-China thaw: Centre fast-tracks business visas; Beijing hails move
description: India has expedited business visa procedures for Chinese professionals, a move aimed at boosting bilateral relations and addressing skilled technician shortages. This development follows statements from Chinese officials expressing willingness to enhance personnel exchanges and work towards resolving border tensions with India.

Employees are working grueling hours amidst restructuring, as the company navigates internal conflicts regarding AI integration and development speed.

title: Census 2027: Govt allocates Rs 11,700 cr; headcount to begin from April
description: India's upcoming census in 2027, costing Rs 11,700 crore, will be the nation's first fully digital exercise. Conducted in two phases from April 2026 to February 2027, it will cover housing and population, including social status and caste details. This significant undertaking is also projected to create one crore employment opportunities.

description: Forex traders said the rupee is under pressure, largely due to aggressive dollar purchases by importers amid surging global precious metal prices

title: Nitish Reddy takes hat-trick in SMAT; dismisses RCB captain - Watch
description: Nitish Kumar Reddy took a hat-trick for Andhra in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy against Madhya Pradesh, reducing them to 14 for 3. Despite Reddy's bowling heroics, MP recovered with a crucial partnership to secure a four-wicket victory. Reddy's hat-trick marked the first of the current tournament season.

description: Headline inflation rose to 0.71% in November 2025. The rural sector experienced increases in both headline and food inflation for November 2025.

title: IndiGo crisis: External expert to identify root cause of chaos; more trouble for airline
description: IndiGo has appointed an external aviation specialist to investigate recent flight disruptions caused by non-compliance with new crew duty norms. The airline's parent company established a crisis management group after large-scale operational breakdowns. The expert will conduct a root cause analysis and identify improvement opportunities.

title: Networking battle: 'Cisco is gaining' - CFO slams HPE-Juniper deal
description: Cisco's CFO Mark Patterson highlighted market uncertainty stemming from Hewlett Packard Enterprise's $14 billion Juniper acquisition. He suggested this integration, particularly in wireless, is causing customer confusion, which Cisco is capitalizing on. This echoes previous Cisco sentiments about the deal's disruptive potential for enterprise clients.

title: Google Flights hacks: Hidden tools for cheaper trips; deals on hotels & flights
description: Planning holiday travel? Google Flights offers smart ways to find budget-friendly flights and hotels. Explore destinations without a set plan by leaving the destination field blank and using the 'Explore' map for lowest prices. Flexibility with dates and locations is key to snagging the best deals. Remember, Google Flights redirects for booking.

title: Man among three arrested after wife dies during abortion at home in Dharmapuri

title: Watch: Fans celebrate release of Rajinikath’s iconic Padayappa
description: Fans across Tamil Nadu are celebrating the re-release of Rajinikanth’s iconic film Padayappa. The 1999 blockbuster has returned to theatres, drawing huge crowds and nostalgic celebrations. We talk to some of them to find out why the movie rules their hearts, twenty-five years after its initial release.

title: Shubman Gill's T20I form a concern? Gujarat Titans head coach Ashish Nehra 'not worried'
description: Shubman Gill’s inconsistent T20I run has sparked criticism, but Gujarat Titans head coach Ashish Nehra remains unfazed, backing his captain to regain form. In a wide-ranging chat, Nehra also praises Washington Sundar’s all-round growth, dismisses trade rumours, and outlines GT’s flexible approach ahead of the mini-auction with a largely settled core.

description: Delhi Capitals, despite a strong start last season, faltered and missed playoffs. Ahead of the IPL auction with Rs 21.80 crore, they aim to fill key gaps, particularly for an explosive opener and death-bowling overseas pacers, while retaining a stable core. Nitish Rana’s arrival could also prove significant for their middle order.

title: Pedestrian Day: Pune Municipal Corporation launches ‘Footpath Repair Campaign’
Psychedelic flight: Alaska pilot cuts fuel mid-air under influence of magic mushrooms— watch
description: An Alaska Airlines pilot, Joseph Emerson, attempted to shut down engines mid-flight after consuming "mushrooms." The audio reveals the panic as the crew subdued him and made an emergency landing in Portland. Emerson stated he wanted to "wake up" and was convinced he wouldn't see his family, attributing his actions to grief and his first experience with psilocybin.

title: New power bloc: Trump may be ditching G7 for new 'Core-5'; which countries are on list
description: Reports suggest Donald Trump is considering a new "Core-5" bloc including China and Russia, a stark contrast to his previous stance. This idea, though unconfirmed, aligns with his transactional approach to foreign policy. The proposal emerges amidst ongoing trade tensions and follows a recent call between PM Modi and Trump.

According to Christopher Wood, the visit signals India's assertion of independence and refusal to be dictated by other powers.  The summit reaffirmed the strong strategic partnership between the two nations.

The state government defied Madras High Court orders to light a ceremonial lamp at Thiruparankundram temple, leading to contempt proceedings and protests. CBSE Board Exams 2026: 6 Key changes students should know about
description: CBSE has announced six major changes for the 2026 board exams that students in Classes 10 and 12 must know. Updates include a new structure for Science and Social Science papers, two annual exam sessions, 75% mandatory attendance, a new 9-point grading system from 2026, provisional Class 11 admission, and a revised paper pattern focusing on competency-based questions. Students are advised to understand these rules, follow the updated guidelines, and prepare accordingly to ensure compliance and maximise exam performance.

description: Evening meals significantly impact gut and liver health. Dr. Sethi highlights simple food pairings like turmeric with black pepper and yogurt with berries that aid digestion and reduce inflammation. Opting for light, colourful, whole-food dinners allows the liver to function smoothly, preventing fatigue and puffiness. Ten easy dinner combinations are provided to support a healthier liver and gut.

title: Trump sanctions hit! Russia records lowest oil exports since Ukraine conflict
description: Russia's oil exports have plummeted to their lowest point since the Ukraine war began, driven by buyer avoidance, tightened US sanctions, and Ukrainian attacks.  This decline, coupled with weakening prices, has slashed Moscow's oil revenue to its lowest since February 2022, straining the Russian budget.

title: Carnage in Dubai: Vaibhav Suryavanshi smashes six-hitting world record at U-19 Asia Cup
description: India's 14-year-old prodigy Vaibhav Suryavanshi smashed a blistering 171 off 95 balls against UAE in the U-19 Asia Cup opener. His innings featured a record-breaking 14 sixes, the most ever in a Youth ODI innings, and also saw him surpass multiple Asian and global records. This remarkable performance further solidifies Suryavanshi's status as a rising star in junior cricket.

title: Watch: At 70 feet, 'world's largest Messi statue' erected in Kolkata ahead of GOAT tour
description: Kolkata is buzzing with anticipation for Lionel Messi's arrival on December 13th. A massive 70-foot statue of the football star has been built. Preparations are in full swing at Salt Lake stadium for the event. Fans are eagerly awaiting Messi's return to the city after 14 years. The atmosphere is electric as the city prepares for a memorable occasion.

The film, directed by Aditya Dhar and featuring a star-studded cast, opened strong and maintained impressive collections throughout the week. Its total India net collection now stands at ₹210.85 crore.

description: Vinesh Phogat, the 31-year-old Indian wrestler, has announced her return to competitive wrestling after an 18-month retirement. Driven by her enduring passion and a desire to achieve her Olympic dream, she aims for the Los Angeles 2028 Games. Phogat, who became a mother in July 2025, sees her son as her "biggest motivation" for this comeback.

description: Rahul Gandhi urged an urgent debate on worsening air pollution, emphasizing it's a non-ideological issue for cooperation. Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju agreed, with the Lok Sabha's Business Advisory Committee to schedule the discussion. Delhi continues to face severe smog, with AQI reaching 'very poor' and 'severe' levels in some areas.

title: IMF slaps Pakistan with 11 more conditions! $7 billion bailout on line
description: The International Monetary Fund has imposed 11 new conditions on Pakistan's $7 billion bailout program, bringing the total to 64 over 18 months. These directives target governance and corruption, requiring asset declarations from high-level civil servants by December next year and an action plan to combat corruption in 10 departments by October next year.

description: Bangladesh's Rizan Hossan expressed confidence in his team's ability to counter young Indian batting sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi in the U-19 Asia Cup final. Despite Suryavanshi's recent stellar form, Hossan believes Bangladesh has the talent to secure their second consecutive title.  Despite Suryavanshi's record-breaking century recently, he highlighted Bangladesh's previous victory over India.

description: A political storm brewed in Parliament after a BJP MP accused a Trinamool Congress lawmaker of using an e-cigarette inside the Lok Sabha, a move allegedly violating a national ban. The BJP lodged a formal complaint, citing the Prohibition of Electronic Cigarettes Act, 2019. TMC, however, dismissed the claims as a manufactured controversy.

description: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old, scored a century in 56 balls against the United Arab Emirates. This happened in the opening match of the ACC U-19 Asia Cup in Dubai. His powerful hitting helped India recover from an early setback. Suryavanshi's performance propelled India to a strong position in the tournament opener. He announced himself as a significant batting talent.

title: 3,500 pages, 300 witnesses: Charge sheet filed in Zubeen Garg death probe; CM vows justice
description: Assam Police's SIT has filed a charge sheet in a Guwahati court regarding the mysterious death of singer Zubeen Garg in Singapore. Garg passed away while swimming on September 19, prompting over 60 FIRs and a state-wide call for a thorough investigation. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma expressed faith in the judicial process for delivering justice.

title: Investing 101: Is it okay to invest if finances aren’t perfect yet? Explained
description: Financial advisors often find clients prioritizing investment choices over fundamental financial health. The article stresses the importance of addressing high-interest debt and establishing an emergency fund before focusing on mutual funds. It outlines a sequence: protect, fix leaks, then chase returns, emphasizing guaranteed returns from debt repayment.

Was Paige Shiver hired to expose Sherrone Moore? Inside the theory fueling the Michigan scandal
description: Former Michigan coach Sherrone Moore's firing and arrest have sparked intense online speculation, primarily focusing on operations staff member Paige Shiver. Theories suggest Shiver may have been hired to expose Moore, fueled by her continued presence on staff after his dismissal for an "inappropriate relationship." Michigan's silence has amplified these unverified claims.

title: Watch: Pakistan assembly speaker finds money on floor — 12 MPs raise hands to claim it
description: A humorous incident unfolded in Pakistan's National Assembly when the Speaker found PKR 5,000 notes on the floor. His call for the owner saw a surprising 12-13 MPs claiming the 10 notes, leading to widespread laughter and social media mockery. The money was eventually retrieved by an MP, but the episode sparked criticism regarding lawmakers' conduct and moral standards.
